abstract: As rumors of a buyout dance around Dow Chemicals, the chemical giant is in talks with India’s Reliance Industries to create a joint venture that would reduce its exposure to the volatile commodity chemicals market. The Financial Times said that reports have suggested that a deal might lead to a takeover of Dow by Reliance, India’s largest public company, sending shares up 5 percent. But unnamed sources told the F.T. that such speculation was untrue.
lead_paragraph: As rumors of a buyout dance around Dow Chemicals, the chemical giant is in talks with India’s Reliance Industries to create a joint venture that would reduce its exposure to the volatile commodity chemicals market. The Financial Times said that reports have suggested that a deal might lead to a takeover of Dow by Reliance, India’s largest public company, sending shares up 5 percent. But unnamed sources told the F.T. that such speculation was untrue.

headline.main: Talk of a Dow Partnership Stirs up Buyout Talk
